isis.stitle: TSI 91-05-04 - Lubrication of TAS Steering Gears

geninfo.para: TAS steering gears must be lubricated at the output shaft dirt and water seal to maintain a grease barrier. The grease barrier will improve seal performance and gear service life by restricting corrosive elements from entering the bearing and high pressure seal area ( Figure 1).
This grease fitting should be greased twice a year using NLGI grade 2 or 3 multipurpose EP chassis lube.

item.para: Before winter to provide a good grease barrier.
After winter to replenish the barrier and force out any contaminated grease.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 91-05-04 - Lubrication of TAS Steering Gears
svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

step1.para: Locate the grease fitting on the trunnion side of the steering gear, near the output shaft.
Use a hand-type grease gun to force grease through the fitting until you can see it past the external dirt and water seal.

caution.para: Do not use an automatic or power grease gun on this fitting, because the rate of flow is too high. This high flow rate could force grease inside the high pressure seal which could contaminate the hydraulic system and also promote seal leakage.
